intro: Dilkea johannesii, commonly known as the Johannesii Dilkea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dilkea johannesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
